data.title: Quavo, Lenny Kravitz Dropping New Track Sampling 'Fly Away'
data.meta_description: Quavo took to Instagram to preview his upcoming single featuring Lenny Kravitz, which includes a sample of Kravitz’s iconic “Fly Away.”
data.text:
Quavo & Lenny Kravitz Dropping New Track Friday Sampling ‘Fly Away’

Earlier this summer, Quavo entered his collaboration era, recently releasing tracks with Lana Del Rey and Peso Pluma. The rapper took to Instagram to preview his upcoming single featuring Lenny Kravitz, which includes a sample of Kravitz’s iconic “Fly Away.”

“When u reach for new heights Sky is the limit! #FLY,” Huncho captioned the clip teasing the song.

Presumably titled “FLY,” based on Quavo’s Instagram captions, the rapper confirmed that the track is set to drop this Friday (August 9). The final clip shows Kravitz and Quavo walking toward the camera, with the longest snippet of the song revealed so far.

“I’m feelin’ the wave / I wanna fly (I wanna fly) / Let’s get geeked, let’s get drunk, let’s get high (Let’s get high),” Quavo raps. “Don’t go on a plane (Phew) / I’m sittin’ in jet way / You already no which way we goin’ (Go), that way (Top).”

The Migos rapper first shared a black-and-white preview of the track last week, writing, “Flyest in the room u jus passed the moon … Fly’n Soon!!!” He has since posted new snippets from the music video shoot, captioning one, “This Is Not a VS!!!,” as the video zoomed in on Kravitz playing guitar.

Producer Southside and artist Chance the Rapper showed their support, with Chance gushing, “This was my favorite song in the world when I was a kid.” However, fan reactions to Quavo’s Lenny Kravitz rework were mixed.

One disappointed fan commented, “What in the high school music is this my n—-?!” Another added, “Boi I outta report yo ahh for this weak shxt.”

On the other hand, another fan appreciated Quavo’s effort to keep his music fresh “Old Lenny Kravitz sample. I love it… The game need more then the same trap beats.”

“Fly Away” originally appeared as a late addition to Lenny Kravitz’s 5 album in 1998. Today, younger fans might recognize the song from a commercial promoting tourism in the Bahamas, featuring Kravitz.

Many people expressed their love for Kravitz in the comments, with one person writing, “His voice carries me away!!!” Another commented, “Love Lenny Kravitz, I’d fly away with him.”

Fittingly, Quavo covered “Fly Away” earlier this year alongside George Clinton at a Los Angeles Grammys party for The Recording Academy Honors, presented by The Black Music Collective (BMC).

In July, Quavo and Lana Del Rey teamed up for a country-rap collaboration titled “Tough.” In the music video, the duo enjoys a leisurely life at a countryside mansion, taking turns shooting guns and cruising in a beat-up Chevy truck. The lyrics capture the perspective of a couple reflecting on life’s hardships after reaching a better place.

Check out the music video here.

Kayla is the midday host on Detroit’s 105.1 The Bounce. She started her career in radio back in 2016 as an intern at another Detroit station and worked her way here. She's made stops in Knoxville, TN, Omaha, Ne and other places before returning to Detroit. She’s done almost everything in radio from promotions to web, creating content on social media, you name it. She’s a true Michigander, born and raised. So, you can catch her camping or vacationing up north to exploring the downtown Detroit or maybe even catching a sports game. During her free time, Kayla enjoys watching movies, roller-skating, crafting, and music festivals. She and her husband together dip into many of the great things Michigan has to offer. Together they also like to travel. A few hobbies of hers include wine and beer tastings, crafting, hiking, roller skating, movies, home improvement projects, gardening, and festivals. She’s always looking to take on more local events happening in the community. She loves connecting with the community. When writing, Kayla covers topics including lifestyle, pop culture, trending stories, hacks, and urban culture.
